comment.author: 19428171@N00
comment._content: This is Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney. I think this photo is from a flower show where she exhibited her dahlias: laura.moncur.org/archives/2008/11/21/so-much-more-than-th...

comment.author: 43671228@N00
comment._content: Wonderful, the way we used to dress.  Thanks for posting this.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: It looks like racing (horse-racing) to me.  Surely that's a jockey cap and boots under the overcoat of the person she is looking up at.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The railing in the background shows up in a lot of Bain racetrack photos. Mrs. Whitney appears to be carrying a dainty pair of binoculars. Her husband, Harry Payne Whitney, was elated by the performance of his horse that day -- it was the star of the show that afternoon, according to the New York Times story next day.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: These were some of New York society's bluebloods at the Belmont Park racetrack, on June 17, 1913. A New York Times story the next day reported the roster of winners: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9406E...
